result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandie Tywon White was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- No firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim without the approval of the Court or agent.
- Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent and consistent with the Family Court Order.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 17 days time served, consecutive to the sentence in case #15CF2417.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months.  Probabtion is to run concurrent to the probabtion ordered in case #15CF2417.


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 01/08/2016.
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, and continued programming.
-Complete a parenting class.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
-Maintain absolute sobriety.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim without the approval or the Court or agent.
-Defendant may have contact with the victim through a third party to arrange time with children as approved by the agent and consistent with the family court order.
-Obtain and maintain employment.
-No firearms.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs, fees, and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.


Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  Case adjourned to Branch 38.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The state has made a new offer to defendant for resolution.  Defense is requesting a plea/sentencing.
Based upon statements to the court the court will modify contact order to be consistent with Family Court order and allow for third party contact with children.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 10, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court heard and denied defense motion to modify the no contact order.  Case remains calendared for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 38 on 8-4-2015 at 8:15 am.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.  mld

Defendant Brandie Tywon White in court with attorney Robert E Webb.  Nicolas J Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State's motion to join cases, no objection by defense counsel, granted by the Court.
Court orders cases adjourned for bail hearing and final pre-trial in Branch 4.  State to contact victim before the next court date.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.
